verses.roman:
śiśu vatsa hari' brahmā kari aparādha
aparādha kṣamāite māgena prasāda

synonyms: śiśu—playmates; vatsa—calves; hari'-stealing; brahmā—Lord Brahmā; kari—making; aparādha—offense; aparādha—offense; kṣamāite—to pardon; māgena—begged; prasāda—mercy.
translation: After Brahmā had offended Kṛṣṇa by stealing His playmates and calves, he begged the Lord's pardon for his offensive act and prayed for the Lord's mercy.
